Definition: You will be given two phrases: Head and Tail, separated with <sep>. Head and Tail are events involving one or more participants. The subject of the event is always PersonX. You have to determine whether the Head event happens after the Tail event. Classify your answers into "Yes" or "No". The phrase may also contain "___", a placeholder that can be an object, a person, and/or an action.
Domains: Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Social Commonsense
Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Spatial Commonsense

Positive Examples.input: Head: PersonX cuts the ribbon<sep>Tail: PersonX opens a store
Positive Examples.explanation: This is a good example. The Head happens after the Tail.

Positive Examples.input: Head: PersonX acquires PersonY knowledge<sep>Tail: He plays also.
Positive Examples.explanation: In this example, the Head and the Tail can happen at the same time. So the output should be"No".

Positive Examples.input: Head: PersonX wants to go outside<sep>Tail: PersonX opens the door
Positive Examples.explanation: In this example, opening the door happens before going out. Thus, this example should be classified as "Yes".

Negative Examples.input: Head: PersonX adapts to PersonY's environment<sep>Tail: accommodating
Negative Examples.explanation: Accommodating is not an event that happens before the Head. So the output should be "No".

Negative Examples.input: Head: PersonX adopts a baby<sep>Tail: PersonX takes adoption classes
Negative Examples.explanation: Adopting a baby happens after taking the adoptions classes, and the output should be "Yes".

Instances.input: Head: PersonX quickly left the house<sep>Tail: PersonX is late going to school
Head: PersonX shows another painting<sep>Tail: PersonX carries paintings into an art gallery
Head: PersonX is really looking forward to it<sep>Tail: PersonX is ready for christmas
Head: PersonX starts off on the wrong foot<sep>Tail: PersonX wakes up late for school
Head: PersonX takes the bus to work<sep>Tail: PersonX walks outside
Head: PersonX trains harder<sep>Tail: PersonX loses a boxing match
Head: PersonX wakes up on the wrong side of bed<sep>Tail: PersonX didn't sleep well
